district.name: Alluri Seetharamaraju District Police
district.background: District carved out of Visakhapatnam & East Godavari in reorganisation of Andhra Pradesh districts.

rampa_rebellion.description: A tribal uprising, also known as Manyam Rebellion, against British colonial administration in the forest tracts.
notable_attacks: Police stations in Chintapalli, Rajavomangi, Krishnadevipeta (Aug 1922) – seized weapons and ammunition.
Ambush in Dammanapalli ghat (Sept 1922) killing British police party.
Raids on police outposts at Addateegala, Rampachodavaram.

goals: Ensure law and order in tribal and remote areas

recent_events.details: 24-year-old Maoist (Kovvasi Deve alias Sumithra) surrendered in ASR district citing disillusionment.
Chaitho (alias Naresh/Santhu), a divisional committee member of Pedabayalu-Korukonda area committee, arrested in forest operation near Killamkota.
Gajarla Ravi alias Uday (CPI-Maoist Central Committee member) was killed in an encounter in ASR district.

militia_surrenders.description: Numerous ‘jan militia’ members (support cadres) surrendered due to pressure, arrests of leadership, and development work in tribal areas. Eg: in 2025, 13 militia surrendered in ASR district. (SATP / local news)

arms_cache_seizures.location: Panaslabanda village, under Sileru PS limits
arms_cache_seizures.items: 6 steel carriage landmines, 2 directional mines, explosive from KEL, ~150 m of electrical wire, nails, iron nuts, Maoist literature

maoist_conflict.conflict_nature: Guerrilla warfare, intermittent firefights, ambushes, use of forest terrain by Maoists, attacks on police camps, booby traps, landmine use
